title: Is it appropriate to use question marks in email? - Quora

response.answer_text: But for the mere sake of proper and effective comprehension…why not? I know that many people imagine their time is so precious that they can’t waste any (but don’t mind wasting yours)… So “you” becomes “u” and “later” amounts to “l8r”…and how much time have you saved? While many prefer to skip subject pronouns how could discriminate between “(I) have signed the contract(!)” and “have (you) signed the contract(?) ? Even if grammatical correctness is not your first priority proper punctuation can be really helpful as here: you really love her! or you really love her? It surely does make a difference, doesn’t it?

If you are asking a question in the email then of course it is. In fact NOT using correct punctuation would be very poor writing. If you ask a question you use a question mark. Sort of a no brainer there.
